economic_context.details: Accused lived on charity after working as prostitute following second husband's death. Community members regularly gave her alms out of fear. Accused also stole wood from neighbors (witness 4). Economic hardship evident: she preferred prostitution to stealing, and recent confessions mention conspiracy about heavy tailles (taxes) imposed.

extraction_metadata.notes: Rich trial record with extensive witness testimony (13 witnesses), detailed confession including sabbat descriptions, accomplice naming, and torture. Accused was elderly (79), worked as healer using techniques learned from mother. Notable elements include: Good Friday birth belief giving healing powers, book of mother's healing knowledge, 'liziere' measuring technique for diagnosing illness, class conflict at sabbat (rich vs poor over hail), prostitution admission, and refusal to harm those who gave her alms. Trial lasted 25 days from informations to execution.
